result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah Christopher Castillo

records.addlTxt: Clerk: EZ. Defendant Isaiah Christopher Castillo in court, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Isaiah Christopher Castillo.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court dismissed case upon plea to 22CM795.

Clerk: EZ. Defendant Isaiah Christopher Castillo in court, in custody.  Attorney Timothy Drewa in court for Isaiah Christopher Castillo.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  (22CM795)  Counsel's first appearance.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea hearing on October 25, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
No contact with KLM's residence. Court allows defendant one 60 minute visit with officer present to pickup personal belongings.

Defendant Isaiah Christopher Castillo appeared by video (via Zoom), in custody with Atty. TImothy Drewa by video (via Zoom).  Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Public Defender will determine whether defendant qualifies for representation (defendant previously advised def. was going to represent himself). Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
